intro: Psoralea juncea, commonly known as slender psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers clustered in racemes. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are trifoliate, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Psoralea juncea is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
